# Competitive analysis template

Understand alternatives and position your Islamic tech idea clearly.

## 1. Direct competitors

Products that solve the same problem for the same (or overlapping) audience.

| Competitor | What they do | Strengths | Weaknesses | Differentiator for us |
|------------|--------------|-----------|------------|------------------------|
|             |              |           |            |                        |
|             |              |           |            |                        |

---

## 2. Indirect competitors

Substitutes or adjacent products (e.g. generic prayer app vs mosque app).

| Name | Why they’re relevant | Our angle |
|------|----------------------|-----------|
|      |                      |           |

---

## 3. Positioning statement

> For [target user] who [need], [Product] is a [category] that [key benefit]. Unlike [alternatives], we [differentiation].

---

## 4. Feature comparison (optional)

| Feature | Us | Competitor A | Competitor B |
|---------|-----|--------------|--------------|
| e.g. Prayer times | ✓ | ✓ | ✓ |
| e.g. Mosque finder | ✓ | ✗ | ✓ |
| e.g. Community / social | ✓ | ✗ | ✗ |

---

## 5. Market gap

- What do users complain about in existing solutions?
- What’s missing in “Islamic” or “halal” positioning?
- Where can we be 10x better or first?

---
